p: The diagnosis was microbiologically confirmed in 17 cases due to presence of C. botulinum type B neurotoxin detected by molecular assay in tissues and/or by serum bioassay. The C. botulinum strains from 10 cases showed a common profile on fAFLP typing, thereby confirming a link to a common source. All had a recent history of injecting heroin which was obtained either in, or sourced, via Glasgow. The source of infection remains unconfirmed but is thought to be due to contaminated heroin, or cutting agent. There were four deaths, botulism contributing to two.
